Description:
PERFECT POSITION - IMPRESSIVE SPACE
Combine all these ingredients: elevation, family friendly dimensions amidst established tiered gardens on a generous 960m2 allotment
and only a stone's throw to Kennington Reservoir . Fabulous flexibility is on offer in this three bedroom plus study, brick veneer home built in the late 1980's. Amazing light spacious formal lounge and dining room. Very large master bedroom with terrific walk in robe and ensuite.
Generous open plan kitchen/meals/living area with feature gas log fire. The well designed kitchen consists of gas hot plates & electric oven, Bosch dishwasher, walk in pantry and offers excellent storage. Extras include ducted gas heating and evaporative cooling. Relax beneath the covered decked pergola area which overlooks the private treed rear garden. An immediately comfortable family home which requires a lift &/or makeover! Double garage, underhouse storage area. Small workshop (conc only). Minutes into Bendigo's CBD & close to all of Strathdale's conveniences including shopping precincts, great schools & Latrobe University.
Di Long : 0417 343 380
Insights: 12 Roslyn Court, Kennington VIC 3550 was last sold in 2015 and 74 other 3 bedroom house in Kennington have recently been sold.

Description:
Priceless Position & Endless Possibilities, For Sale Now Or By Auction
Rarely does an opportunity present itself to acquire a property that has so much to offer. Situated in a tightly held area close to the city and Kennington Oval, this enviable location offers options as a large family home or for potential subdivision of the large1309m2 allotment (STCA).
Purchasers will be instantly drawn to the street appeal of this California bungalow and fall in love with the original features throughout the home. The four bedrooms will accommodate the family easily and 2 large living areas showcase the 12ft decorative ceilings found throughout the home. Outside currently offers multiple shedding options and a large grassed area for the kids to play happily.
The features are endless and can only truly be appreciated by inspecting this property that has not changed owners in the last 42 years. Dont miss your chance to give this timeless beauty a new beginning and reap the rewards in the future.
Insights: 64 Neale Street, KENNINGTON VIC 3550 was last sold in 2015 and 26 other 4 bedroom house in KENNINGTON have recently been sold.

Description:
PERFECT LOCATION, FAMILY ENTERTAINER
Sitting in a great position this fantastic family home is ready and waiting for its new owners! Comprising 4 bedrooms plus a study the master includes a full ensuite and walk in robe with its own private fernery views whilst the remaining 3 bedrooms are a great size with built in robes. The living space is generous offering a large formal lounge with a cosy gas log heater, refurbished kitchen and family space and a separate dining room. Ducted evaporative cooling plus a 1.5 kw solar system are an added bonus. There is also a large family bathroom and generous sized laundry to finish off the inside of the property. The outside beckons through the sliding doors with an expansive 'must see' entertaining area offering a large patio and a generous timber deck with a swimming pool. Set on a block of over 1,100m2 the property also includes a double carport, separate garage with side access, over 5000lt of rainwater storage and large easy to maintain grounds. All this set within easy walking distance to the Kennington Village and Reservoir, walking tracks, schools and La Trobe University it really is position perfect!
Please note: ALL ENQUIRIES MUST INCLUDE A PHONE NUMBER

Description:
What A Find..! More Like A Home Than A Unit.
This 2 bedroom double brick unit is situated at the end of a quiet cul-de-sac in the highly desirable heart of Kennington. Comprising of a beautifully modernised well equipped kitchen with a new quality dishwasher, gas burners and electric wall oven, separate large pantry & a lovely garden view. The living area is open and light. Generous sized bedrooms include built in robes & dresser drawers, central bathroom with large corner shower & bath, plus separate toilet. Central heating & refrigerated cooling for year round comfort & plenty of storage, in fact more than the usual amount that you'd expect in a unit. Outside you'll find a single carport and an adjacent parking space in the common area. Low maintenance landscaping to the front and rear with an undercover outdoor area to relax & entertain, plus a handy garden shed. All this secluded away in an attractive & private group of only 4 units with plenty of space between them. Just a 600 metre walk to the supermarket, 240m to public transport and 60m to the playground. A quick 2km drive will take you to the CBD. Previously rented at $265 per week, this makes an ideal investment, however with the fresh tender loving care this home has received it really is perfect for someone who wants to enjoy a low maintenance lifestyle, with modern conveniences, in a great location.
Insights: 4/4 Carola Court, Kennington VIC 3550 was last sold in 2015 and 21 other 2 bedroom unit in Kennington have recently been sold.

Description:
OH SO CONVENIENT!
Modern, spacious and in a prime location. An easy walk to Schools, University, Cafe's & excellent access to the CBD. With three well-appointed bedrooms, the master has walk-in robe and ensuite. Large open plan lounge. The kitchen is well appointed with appliances complementing a very functional space. This open plan meals / kitchen is spacious & leads through sliding glass doors to the BBQ and secure courtyard where a lovely entertaining area is positioned amongst the lush garden offering shade and comfort. Ducted gas heating and ducted evaporative cooling ensure year round comfort. The home has a wonderful ambience, and is extremely well located to suit a myriad of buyers.

251

Description:
Prime & Prosperous Position
Offering exclusive views across Kennington is this primly located 916sqm allotment.
One of the last in this beautifully established Street to sit unoccupied the potential for this space is absolutely endless.
The location of this unique allotment is extremely attractive; you have remarkable water views of the Kennington Reservoir, the close proximity to the Kennington Primary School and La Trobe University is idyllic for a growing family and the 2 minute walk to the recently constructed Kennington Village is ever so convenient!
Situated on an elevated parcel your dream home is ready and awaiting commencement! This stylish street scope is well maintained and versatile in welcoming the ultra modern design or more traditional elegant design.
If you are searching for the perfect piece of property to construct the dream home that suits every aspect of your lifestyle this desirable address is definitely worth sighting.
Phone the agent today for any further queries!

Description:
OUTSTANDING HOME - TOP LOCATION!
An absolute privilege to offer this beautiful cream brick veneer residence for reluctant sale. Description:
A Fresh Face In Classic Kennington.
Cleverly designed townhouse which features three-bedroom, two versatile living areas, two bathrooms, new open-plan galley style kitchen and dining area plus a stunning, elevated entertaining deck.
This larger and lighter home includes all modern living essentials like ducted heating, evaporative cooling, stainless steel cooking appliances and fitted robes in all bedrooms, with the luxury continuing all the way to the bathrooms with full-wall tiling and quality fittings to both.
Classy open-plan living, dining and kitchen spaces enjoy a seamless flow to the front alfresco deck where you can enjoy entertaining with a backdrop of timeless views over the city through to the cathedral spire.
Suitable for a range of ages and stages, this home is equally suited to families or downsizers/empty nesters. The main bedroom and ensuite are located at the front while the remaining bedrooms, main bathroom and rear sitting room are conveniently grouped together - perfect for teens or guests.
Immaculately presented inside and out with a stylish yet understated dÃÂ©cor and distinctive touches like the coffered ceiling and open fireplace with Jetmaster insert in the lounge and beautifully polished hardwood floors throughout.
Manicured landscaping includes a secure, private front courtyard and enclosed back garden with access to a double garage at the rear.
Located in a very quiet, wide street within walking distance to walk to the CBD, railway station, Coles supermarket, Kennington oval, pubs and corner shop.

Description:
AS GOOD AS THEY COME
As magnificently original as they come. Generous proportions throughout with a wonderful wet bar adjoining the meals and family with cathedral ceilings and light filled pockets. Kitchen with walk-in-pantry and an arched servery to meals area. This solid well built home has been in the same family for decades and meticulously cared for. Timber lined walls, timber windows and built in joinery, offering storage options throughout the whole home. Three bedrooms and study. Master with sliding doors to the rear yard, walk through robe and ensuite. Sitting on 842m2 on the Corner of The Strand & Yallambee in a prominent McIvor Hill location. This property is in amazing condition but lends itself to what could be an impressive renovation. Ducted floor heating, additional split systems and dishwasher keeps this one still modern & functional. Double carport and double side gate access to the rear yard that is both low maintenance and quietly private.

Description:
SUPERIOR QUALITY & POSITION
Perfectly positioned in a highly sought-after location with stunning street appeal, this immaculately presented executive built home will impress at first sight. Offering high quality fixtures and fitting throughout, the practical floor plan comprises 3 bedrooms, the main with walk in robe and a luxurious ensuite, with built in robes to the remaining 2 bedrooms, the 3rd ideally positioned at the front of the house with a lovely outlook to the front garden. The home also offers an open plan meals and kitchen area with ample bench space and a handy corner pantry, 2 great living spaces including a formal sitting room and large formal lounge, excellent storage throughout including a walk in linen press and the convenience of ducted evaporative cooling and gas heating ensuring year round comfort. Moving outside, the home offers immaculately presented gardens, a centrally positioned courtyard, low maintenance landscaped surrounds plus a spacious double garage with auto roller doors. With a stunning bush outlook and great access to walking tracks, the new Kennington Village and the CBD, the home is ideal for the retirees or professional couple alike. An inspection is sure to impress!

Description:
POSITION, POSITION - INVEST OR NEST!!
Situated within walking distance to Strath Hill & Strath Village shopping centers, La Trobe uni, primary schools, doctors etc., this pristine home is all set to move in to or rent out. The single garage has been converted into a 2nd living area or 3rd bedroom, but could be easily reverted back to it's original use if garaging is a priority. There are built-in-robes in the dedicated two bedrooms, with a three piece 2-way bathroom off the main bedroom. A gas wall furnace and a reverse cycle unit are more than adequate to ensure a comfy internal environment. Sited on a neat, compact block of about 480m2, there's still room for the kiddies to play and features an attractive garden, which would be easily maintained. Expected rental of $280 to $300 per week.

Description:
Picturesque Views Across Kennington
With entertaining options galore, including an inviting solar heated in-ground pool, and surprising views, this immaculately presented abode has it all.
Set well back from the street on an elevated site the house has an impressive minimal maintenance frontage of beautifully manicured shrubs, encircled by neat brick edges and surrounded by a stone landscape.
The front door is through a lovely brick-paved courtyard fernery; just one of many relaxation options.
Inside, an L-shape hallway has three bedrooms off it along one side.
Ducted floor heating, a reverse-cycle split-system and ceiling fans throughout temper the climate at all times.
There are plenty of storage options as well including linen, laundry and living room storage.
Two bedrooms have two-door built-in wardrobes while the main has a three-door arrangement and a three-piece en suite with a separate shower.
To service the other bedrooms there's a family bathroom with a separate shower and bath and featuring a box-bay window overlooking a fernery.
Also off the hallway is a large formal lounge and dining area with a brick arch leading through to a spacious kitchen, dining and second living zone.
The kitchen has all you need: electric wall oven and hotplate, a dishwasher, a long work bench and great storage including two by two-door built-in pantries.
A sliding door opens to a brick-paved alfresco area overlooking the pool (which has a new pump) and wonderful tree-top views.
Lawn and flower beds surround the house and a garden sprinkler system eliminates the need to water. There's also a garden shed.
The double garage has a lock-up roller door and backyard access.
Kennington Reservoir offers morning or evening jaunts, schools and a uni are close and you'll never tire of the shopping choices at Strath Village, Kennington Village and Strath Hill shopping centres, all an easy walk.
Insights: 7 Primrose Court, KENNINGTON VIC 3550 was last sold in 2018 and 74 other 3 bedroom house in KENNINGTON have recently been sold.

Description:
Fantastic Development Opportunity!!
Set in a very prestigious and popular area in Kennington, is this three bedroom home on a large 1137m2 allotment with subdivision potential (S.T.C.A). The home includes a lounge, kitchen/dining, two air-conditioners, 3 piece bathroom and laundry. Outside, there are great views of the area and the opportunity to subdivide (S.T.C.A). Currently rented out at $240 per week, to a tenant who is keen to stay on, but vacant possession at settlement can be arranged. Close to university, school, shops and public transport. Inspect Now!

Description:
A Classic on Clarence
Set on a quiet tree-lined street, this two-bedroom home in original condition has loads of charm & charisma, with the potential to renovate to three.
Close to all amenities including Kennington Primary School, La Trobe University, and shopping centres, it's ideal for first-home buyers, a professional couple or retirees. A one-roomed bungalow in the backyard is a bonus.
Shade trees dot the front garden, there are two entrances from the concrete patio: a single door and french doors that open into a hallway. We entered via the single door. The care that's been shown this one-owner home over the years is clearly evident.
On the left is a delightfully inviting lounge room with a lovely ambience. The slate fireplace, with a gas heater set into it, is definitely the highlight. Deep cornices and picture rails are other features. There's also a wall-mounted air-conditioner and ceiling fan.
Sliding glass doors open to reveal an adjoining dining room while through another sliding door is the bright and cheerful kitchen. There are no high-tech appliances here, but an upright electric stove serves the owner well as does above- and underbench storage. And again, the ambience.
Two bedrooms with built-in wardrobes and a three-piece bathroom, with a deep bath and separate shower, are towards the front of the home. The main bedroom has a reverse-cycle split-system, ceiling fan and corner windows overlooking the front garden.
From the kitchen, a door with a quirky porthole window opens to a small vestibule with a laundry.
A vine-covered verandah is your introduction to the split-level backyard where you can plant vegies, and enjoy the serenity.
This home is a classic, so don't procrastinate!
Insights: 15 Clarence Avenue, KENNINGTON VIC 3550 was last sold in 2015 and 17 other 2 bedroom house in KENNINGTON have recently been sold.

Description:
Classic Californian Bungalow â Close to CBD!
Oozing all the classic features such as decorative timber fretwork, plate racks/rails, patterned ceilings and cornices, and a stately front verandah; this home offers a perfect opportunity to renovate and reap the rewards. Includes 3 good size bedrooms, formal lounge, (gas heating), formal dining and separate kitchen. Outside includes an established garden with single garage and shed. Situated only a short walk to the CBD, Latrobe University, schools shopping and eateries, the position offers real convenience. A classic period home with huge potential and all the convenience of location. Don't delay, will not last!
